conclusion: Points A, B, and C are the sources of liquid, and the liquid will flow down due to gravity, influenced by horizontal and vertical baffles.
Point A is located at the top left, point B is in the middle, and point C is at the top right. Containers D and E are at the bottom.
The liquid from point A flows vertically downward.
The liquid from point A encounters a horizontal baffle that diverts it horizontally to the left.
The liquid from point A continues flowing horizontally until it hits another vertical baffle.
The vertical baffle diverts the liquid from point A downward again.
The liquid from point A continues flowing downward until it reaches the bottom of the setup.
The liquid from point A ends up in container E.
The liquid from point B flows vertically downward.
The liquid from point B encounters a horizontal baffle that diverts it horizontally to the right.
The liquid from point B continues flowing horizontally until it hits another vertical baffle.
The vertical baffle diverts the liquid from point B downward again.
The liquid from point B continues flowing downward until it reaches the bottom of the setup.
The liquid from point B ends up in container D.
The liquid from point C flows vertically downward.
The liquid from point C encounters a horizontal baffle that diverts it horizontally to the right.
The liquid from point C continues flowing horizontally until it hits another vertical baffle.
The vertical baffle diverts the liquid from point C downward again.
The liquid from point C continues flowing downward until it reaches the bottom of the setup.
The liquid from point C ends up in container D.
Liquid from point A flows into container E, and liquid from points B and C flows into container D.
The liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into containers as follows: Point A: Container E, Points B and C: Container D.
